str:Code.com:Description: Period average, index weighted by imports is the mean value of an index (e.g., price index, exchange rate index) for a group of a country's trading partners over a specific period, where the index values for each partner are weighted by their respective shares in the reporting country's total imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, index, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change in the average value of an index over two consecutive years. This provides a measure of how the average relative value (compared to the base period) has changed over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, median, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to the percentage change in the median value of a dataset over a specific period, compared to the median value of a reference period or a baseline value. The median is the middle value in a dataset when the values are arranged in ascending or descending order. This measure is less sensitive to outliers than the mean and provides a robust measure of the central tendency of the data.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to the percentage change in the average value of a dataset over a specific period compared to a reference value, which is often the average value of a previous period or a baseline value.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, percent change, impact
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to the percentage change in the average value of a dataset over a specific period compared to a reference value, along with an assessment of the impact or significance of this change. The impact might be evaluated in terms of its economic, social, or environmental consequences.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, percent difference from baseline (FSGM scenario)
str:Code.com:Description: In a Financial Sector General Model (FSGM) scenario, this refers to the percentage difference in a specific variable or outcome between a baseline scenario (often a "business as usual" scenario) and a stress-test scenario (e.g., a severe economic downturn). This is used to assess the impact of different economic conditions or policy changes on the financial sector.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, rate
str:Code.com:Description: The average value of a rate (e.g., interest rate, exchange rate) over a specific period.

str:Code.com:Name: End-of-period (EoP), period-over-period percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change between data points at the end of two consecutive periods.

str:Code.com:Name: Period-over-period percent change, period average
str:Code.com:Description: Average percentage change of the data series over a defined period.

str:Code.com:Name: Period-over-preceding period percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Represents the percentage change between the current period and the one immediately preceding it.

str:Code.com:Name: Pre-EURO, end-of-period (EoP)
str:Code.com:Description: The value of a variable at the end of a specific period before the introduction of the Euro as a currency. This is often used for historical data analysis in European countries that adopted the Euro, allowing for comparisons of economic indicators before and after the currency transition.

str:Code.com:Name: Pre-EURO, period average
str:Code.com:Description: The average value of a variable over a specific period before the introduction of the Euro as a currency. This is often used for historical data analysis in European countries that adopted the Euro, allowing for comparisons of economic indicators before and after the currency transition.

str:Code.com:Name: Previous period (PP)
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to the time period immediately preceding the current period being analyzed. Typically used together with Percent and Percent Change.

str:Code.com:Name: Proportion of domestic budget funded by domestic taxes
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to the percentage of a government's budget that is financed through taxes collected within the country. This excludes other sources of government revenue, such as foreign aid, borrowing, or income from state-owned enterprises. A higher proportion indicates greater self-reliance and less dependence on external financing.

str:Code.com:Name: Proportion of total government spending
str:Code.com:Description: Share of a specific variable in total government spending.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP)
str:Code.com:Description: Rates of currency conversion that equalize purchasing power by eliminating price level differences between countries.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP) international dollar
str:Code.com:Description: Rates of currency conversion that equalize purchasing power by eliminating price level differences between countries.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP) international dollar, percent of regional groups GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Contribution of a region to a group's GDP, adjusted for cost-of-living differences.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP) international dollar, percent of world GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Share of global GDP attributed to a country, adjusted for purchasing power parity.

str:Code.com:Name: Per capita, Purchasing power parity (PPP), percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Rate of change in the average purchasing power per person in a country over a specific period.

str:Code.com:Name: Per capita, Purchasing power parity (PPP), year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percentage change in average value per capita, adjusted for purchasing power parity, over two consecutive years.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP) weighted
str:Code.com:Description: PPP-adjusted metrics to make accurate economic comparisons between countries by considering price levels of a basket of goods and services.

str:Code.com:Name: Purchasing power parity (PPP), percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Rate at which the relative purchasing power of two currencies changes over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Quarter-over-quarter percent change, annualized index
str:Code.com:Description: Annualized QOQ percent change of a specific index.

str:Code.com:Name: QOQ percent change, period average index, annualized
str:Code.com:Description: Annualized QOQ percent change of an index, smoothed over a certain period.

str:Code.com:Name: Quarter-over-quarter percent change, annualized
str:Code.com:Description: QOQ percent change projected forward as if it were to continue for a full year.

str:Code.com:Name: End-of-period (EoP), Quarter-over-quarter percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change between data points at the end of two consecutive quarters.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, annualized, Quarter-over-quarter percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Annualized QOQ percent change averaged over a defined period.

str:Code.com:Name: Rare earth carbonate REO 42-45 Dom
str:Code.com:Description: Specific rare earth carbonate material with a defined range of Rare Earth Oxide (REO) content.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of GDP from preceding period, GDP market exchange rates weighted aggregate
str:Code.com:Description: Ratio of GDP from the previous period adjusted for market exchange rates, weighted by aggregate.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of GDP from previous period
str:Code.com:Description: The ratio of GDP from the preceding period is a measure of the percentage change in a country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) compared to the previous period. This period can be a month, quarter, or year, depending on the frequency of the GDP data.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of GDP from previous period, GDP market exchange rates weighted aggregate
str:Code.com:Description: Calculation comparing the current combined GDP of countries to their combined GDP from a previous period, weighted by market exchange rates.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of GDP from previous period, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The "Ratio of GDP from the previous period, percent change" is more commonly known as the GDP growth rate. It measures the percentage change in a country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) over a specific period, usually compared to the previous quarter or year.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of monetary base to broad money
str:Code.com:Description: Measure of how much of a country's broad money supply is supported by the central bank's monetary base.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of monetary base to broad money, percent per annum
str:Code.com:Description: Annual rate of the ratio of monetary base to broad money, often tracked over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of net transfers to own revenue
str:Code.com:Description: Proportion of a government's net transfers relative to its own revenue.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of net transfers to own spending
str:Code.com:Description: Ratio comparing a government's net transfers to its total spending.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of own revenue to own spending
str:Code.com:Description: Ratio comparing a government's own revenue to its total spending.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of own revenues to general government revenues
str:Code.com:Description: Comparison of specific level government revenue to total revenue of all levels of government.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of own spending to general government spending
str:Code.com:Description: Comparison of specific level government spending to total spending of all levels of government.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of total reserves minus gold to imports (CIF)
str:Code.com:Description: Measure of a country's financial reserves (excluding gold) relative to its imports (cost, insurance, freight).

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio of total reserves minus gold to imports CIF
str:Code.com:Description: This ratio compares a country's total foreign exchange reserves (excluding gold) to the value of its imports, including the cost of goods, insurance, and freight (CIF).

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio to total labor force
str:Code.com:Description: This means that the value being presented is expressed as a proportion or percentage of the total labor force. The labor force includes all people who are either employed or actively seeking employment. This is often used to analyze labor market indicators such as unemployment rates or labor force participation rates.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio to total population
str:Code.com:Description: This means that the value being presented is expressed as a proportion or percentage of the total population. This is often used for demographic or social indicators, such as poverty rates or literacy rates.

str:Code.com:Name: Ratio to US GDP deflator
str:Code.com:Description: Metric comparing the price level or inflation rate of a country or region to that of the United States.

str:Code.com:Name: Recent fixed weighted imports to GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Weights individual commodities in an import index based on their share of the country's GDP, using recent fixed weights.

str:Code.com:Name: Recent rolling weighted imports to GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Weights individual commodities in an import index based on their share of the country's GDP, using recent rolling weights.

str:Code.com:Name: Revisions, difference to last transmission period
str:Code.com:Description: Changes made to a previously reported data point compared to its value in the last reporting period.

str:Code.com:Name: Rolling weighted imports to GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Weights individual commodities in an import index based on their share of the country's GDP, using historical rolling weights.

str:Code.com:Name: Saving ratio
str:Code.com:Description: Proportion of disposable income saved rather than spent on consumption.

str:Code.com:Name: Index referenced in SDRs
str:Code.com:Description: Index referenced in SDRs.

str:Code.com:Name: Semi-annual (half-over-half)
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to a method of calculating interest or growth rates where the rate is applied twice a year, with each application using half of the annual rate. This is often used for bonds or other financial instruments that make semi-annual interest payments.

str:Code.com:Name: Semi-annual (half-over-half) percent change, annualized
str:Code.com:Description: The half-over-half percent change is the percentage change in a value from the first half of a year to the second half. The annualized half-over-half percent change projects this change forward as if it were to continue for a full year. This is a way to annualize growth rates that are measured over half-year periods.

str:Code.com:Name: Services Export Density Index
str:Code.com:Description: A country's likelihood to export services in the future.

str:Code.com:Name: Services Export Path Index
str:Code.com:Description: A service's association to other services.

str:Code.com:Name: Services Export Revealed Comparative Advantage Index
str:Code.com:Description: Revealed Comparative Advantage (degree of specialization) for a country to export a specific service sector.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of exports in country's service export basket
str:Code.com:Description: Share of exports in a country's service export basket.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of exports in country's service export basket, 1 digit level
str:Code.com:Description: Share of exports in a country's service export basket, 1-digit level.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of exports in country's service export basket, 2 digit level
str:Code.com:Description: Share of exports in a country's service export basket, 2-digit level.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of goods exports in total exports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: Share of goods exports in total exports, averaged over a period.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of service exports in GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Percent of total export of services for a country as a share of country GDP. More formally, Total Service Exports (current US$) / GDP (current US$).

str:Code.com:Name: Share of service exports in total exports
str:Code.com:Description: Percent of total export basket accounted by Service Exports. More formally, Total Service Exports (current US$) / Total Exports of Goods and Services (current US$).

str:Code.com:Name: Share of service exports in total exports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: Average annual percent of Service Exports in Regional Aggregate Total Export Basket.

str:Code.com:Name: Share of service exports in world service exports
str:Code.com:Description: Percent of total export basket in world service exports. More formally, Total Service Exports in Country (current US$) / Total Exports of Services Exports in World (current US$).

str:Code.com:Name: Share of service exports in world service exports, diversity
str:Code.com:Description: Percent of total export basket in world service exports. More formally, Total Service Exports in Country (current US$) / Total Exports of Services Exports in World (current US$).

str:Code.com:Name: Shares
str:Code.com:Description: Indicates a part or portion of something.

str:Code.com:Name: Short-term debt indexed to the exchange rate
str:Code.com:Description: Short-term debt indexed to the exchange rate refers to debt instruments with a maturity of less than one year where the principal and/or interest payments are linked to the exchange rate between two currencies.

str:Code.com:Name: Short-term debt indexed to the exchange rate
str:Code.com:Description: Short-term debt indexed to the exchange rate for specific measurements.

str:Code.com:Name: Short-term domestic currency debt indexed to the exchange rate
str:Code.com:Description: Short-term domestic currency debt indexed to the exchange rate refers to debt issued by a government or corporation in its own currency with a maturity of less than one year, where the principal and/or interest payments are linked to the exchange rate with another currency, typically a major international currency like the US dollar or the euro.

str:Code.com:Name: Short-term domestic currency debt indexed to the exchange rate
str:Code.com:Description: Short-term debt indexed to the exchange rate for specific measurements.

str:Code.com:Name: Standard reference period
str:Code.com:Description: Benchmark time frame used for comparison in statistical analyses.

str:Code.com:Name: Terms of trade of goods
str:Code.com:Description: The ratio of a country's export prices to its import prices for goods.

str:Code.com:Name: Terms of trade of goods and services
str:Code.com:Description: The ratio of a country's export prices to its import prices for both goods and services.

str:Code.com:Name: Terms of trade of goods and services, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change in the terms of trade of goods and services over a specific period.

str:Code.com:Name: Terms of trade of goods, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change in the terms of trade of goods over a specific period.

str:Code.com:Name: THB per kilogram
str:Code.com:Description: Thai baht per kilogram for specific commodity or measurement.

str:Code.com:Name: Total financial system assets
str:Code.com:Description: Total financial system assets represent the combined value of all financial assets held within a country's financial system.

str:Code.com:Name: Valuation of country GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Method used to express the monetary value of a country's gross domestic product (GDP).

str:Code.com:Name: Weight
str:Code.com:Description: Weight refers to a numerical value assigned to each observation in a dataset to adjust its relative importance in calculations.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average
str:Code.com:Description: An average calculated by assigning weights to values based on their relative importance.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel commodity exports
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average based on non-fuel commodity exports for the reporting country.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel commodity imports
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average based on non-fuel commodity imports for the reporting country.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel exports, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change in the weighted average by non-fuel exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel exports, year-over-year change
str:Code.com:Description: Year-over-year percent change in the weighted average by non-fuel exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel imports, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change in the weighted average by non-fuel imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average by non-fuel imports, year-over-year change
str:Code.com:Description: Year-over-year percent change in the weighted average by non-fuel imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of exports
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average of a specific variable (e.g., inflation rate, GDP growth) for a group of a country's trading partners, where the values for each partner are weighted by their respective shares in the reporting country's total exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of imports
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average of a specific variable (e.g., inflation rate, GDP growth) for a group of a country's trading partners, where the values for each partner are weighted by their respective shares in the reporting country's total imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components (exports)
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average of the unit value for manufactures, oil price, and non-fuel commodity export price, weighted by the composition of exports for the reporting country.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components (imports)
str:Code.com:Description: A weighted average of the unit value for manufactures, oil price, and non-fuel commodity export price, weighted by the composition of imports for the reporting country.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change in the weighted average for the reporting country's imports composition.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components, percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Percent change in the weighted average for the reporting country's exports composition.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components, year-over-year change
str:Code.com:Description: Year-over-year percent change in the weighted average for the reporting country's imports composition.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average of three components, year-over-year change
str:Code.com:Description: Year-over-year percent change in the weighted average for the reporting country's exports composition.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted average, over 12 periods
str:Code.com:Description: A calculation that gives more importance or weight to certain values within a dataset of 12 time periods.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted by exports
str:Code.com:Description: Concept is weighted by exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted by GDP, period average, index
str:Code.com:Description: An index calculated as the average of values over a specific period, where each value is weighted by its corresponding GDP. This method gives more importance to periods with higher GDP in the calculation of the average. This type of index is often used to track economic trends over time, where the weights reflect the relative importance of different periods in the overall economic activity.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted by imports
str:Code.com:Description: Concept is weighted by imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Individual commodities weighted by ratio of imports to total commodity imports
str:Code.com:Description: Weights commodities in an import index based on their share of the total value of commodity imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Individual commodities weighted by ratio of imports to GDP
str:Code.com:Description: Weights individual commodities in an import index based on their share of the country's GDP.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted kurtosis
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical measure that quantifies the "tailedness" of a probability distribution relative to a normal distribution. In weighted kurtosis, each data point is assigned a weight that influences its contribution to the overall calculation, reflecting its relative importance.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted percent
str:Code.com:Description: A percentage calculation where each component or category is assigned a weight that reflects its relative importance or contribution to the total.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted quartiles
str:Code.com:Description: The division of a dataset into four equal groups based on their values, but where each value is assigned a weight. The weighted quartiles (25th, 50th, 75th percentiles) indicate the distribution of the data while taking into account the relative importance of each observation.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted quartiles, 1st quartile
str:Code.com:Description: The weighted 1st quartile (Q1) is the value that divides the lowest 25% of the dataset from the remaining 75%, with the observations in the dataset weighted by the respective deposit-takers' total assets.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted quartiles, 2nd quartile
str:Code.com:Description: The weighted 2nd quartile (Q2) or weighted median, is the value that divides the dataset that is sorted in ascending order into two halves, with the observations in the dataset weighted by the respective deposit-takers' total assets.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted quartiles, 3rd quartile
str:Code.com:Description: The weighted 3rd quartile (Q3) is The value that divides the highest 25% of the dataset from the remaining 75%, with the observations in the dataset weighted by the respective deposit-takers' total assets.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted kurtosis
str:Code.com:Description: A combination of two statistical measures: weighted quartiles (as defined above) and weighted kurtosis. This provides a comprehensive view of both the distribution of the data and its tailedness, considering the relative importance of each data point.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted skewness
str:Code.com:Description: A combination of weighted quartiles and weighted skewness. Weighted skewness measures the asymmetry of a probability distribution, taking into account the weights of individual data points. Together, these measures provide insights into the shape and distribution of data with varying levels of importance assigned to observations.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted standard deviation
str:Code.com:Description: A combination of weighted quartiles and weighted standard deviation. Weighted standard deviation measures the dispersion of a dataset, considering the weights of each data point. This combination offers a comprehensive picture of the data's central tendency, dispersion, and distribution, while accounting for the relative importance of each value.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted skewness
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical measure that quantifies the asymmetry of a probability distribution, taking into account the weights of individual data points. A positive skewness indicates a longer tail on the right side, while a negative skewness indicates a longer tail on the left side.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted standard deviation
str:Code.com:Description: A measure of the dispersion of a dataset, where each data point is assigned a weight that reflects its relative importance. This is a variation of the standard deviation that considers the varying significance of different observations in the dataset.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted value
str:Code.com:Description: The result of multiplying a data point by its corresponding weight.

str:Code.com:Name: World aggregate
str:Code.com:Description: The combined or total value of a particular economic indicator or variable across all countries globally. This provides a comprehensive picture of the global economic landscape.

str:Code.com:Name: Yearly average
str:Code.com:Description: Average value of a data series over a calendar year.

str:Code.com:Name: End-of-period (EoP), year-over-year (YOY) per capita percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change between the end-of-period value per capita for the current year and the end-of-period value per capita for the previous year.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change weighted by exports
str:Code.com:Description: Percentage change over two consecutive years, weighted by the export quantities for each period. This provides a measure of how the value has changed over two consecutive years, taking into account the relative importance of different products based on their export volumes.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change weighted by exports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: The average year-on-year percentage change in a data series, weighted by the export quantities for each period. This provides a measure of how the average value has changed over two consecutive years, taking into account the relative importance of different products based on their export volumes.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change weighted by imports
str:Code.com:Description: Percentage change over two consecutive years, weighted by the import quantities for each period. This provides a measure of how the value has changed over two consecutive years, taking into account the relative importance of different products based on their import volumes.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change weighted by imports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: The average year-on-year percentage change in a data series, weighted by the import quantities for each period. This provides a measure of how the average value has changed over time, taking into account the relative importance of different products based on their import volumes.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, based on market exchange rates
str:Code.com:Description: Percentage change over two consecutive years, after adjusting the values from one currency to another using market exchange rates. This provides a measure of the change in the variable's value excluding the influence of currency fluctuations.

str:Code.com:Name: End-of-period (EoP), Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percent change between the data points at the end of two consecutive years.

str:Code.com:Name: GDP market exchange rates weighed aggregate, year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: It refers to the percentage change in the combined GDP of multiple countries compared to the same period in the previous year. Each country's GDP is first converted to a common currency (usually US dollars) using market exchange rates, then weighted based on its economic significance, and finally aggregated. The YOY percentage change reflects the overall growth or contraction of the combined economies, considering both individual GDP changes and fluctuations in exchange rates.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) period average
str:Code.com:Description: The average change over two consecutive years.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, period average
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years in the average value of an index for the current period compared to the previous period. This provides a measure of how the average relative value (compared to the base period) has changed over two consecutive periods.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, period average index
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years in the average value of an index for the current period compared to the previous period. This provides a measure of how the average relative value (compared to the base period) has changed over two consecutive periods.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, period average, seasonally adjusted (SA)
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years between the seasonally adjusted (SA) average values for the current period and the previous period. This provides a measure of how the average value has changed over two consecutive years, excluding the influence of seasonal patterns.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, period average, weighted average of the partner countries' data weighted by the partner countries' shares in reporting country's exports
str:Code.com:Description: The average percentage change over two consecutive years in a specific variable for a group of a country's trading partners, weighted by their respective shares in the reporting country's total exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, period average, weighted average of the partner countries' data weighted by the partner countries' shares in reporting country's imports
str:Code.com:Description: The average percentage change over two consecutive years in a specific variable for a group of a country's trading partners, weighted by their respective shares in the reporting country's total imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, weighted average of the partner countries' data weighted by the partner countries' shares in reporting country's exports
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years in a weighted average of a specific variable for a group of a country's trading partners, where the weights are based on their respective shares in the reporting country's total exports.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change, weighted average of the partner countries' data weighted by the partner countries' shares in reporting country's imports
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years in a weighted average of a specific variable for a group of a country's trading partners, where the weights are based on their respective shares in the reporting country's total imports.

str:Code.com:Name: Year-to-date (YTD)
str:Code.com:Description: The cumulative value of a particular economic indicator or variable from the beginning of the current calendar year up to the present date.

str:Code.com:Name: Percent of quota per annum
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to the percent of IMF Quota utilized or represented.

str:Code.com:Name: Partner trade weighted index, adjusted by relative consumer prices, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Trade-weighted index adjusted for inflation differences between the country and its trade partners, year over year percent change.

str:Code.com:Name: Advanced economy trade partner weighted
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted average value for a specific variable, reflecting advanced economies trade partners.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted index
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted average value for a specific variable, reflecting the relative importance of major trade partners.

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted by relative consumer prices
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index adjusted for inflation differences between the country and its trade partners.

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted by relative unit labor costs (advanced economies only)
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index adjusted for relative changes in labor costs between the country and its trade partners.

str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting major trade partner economies, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Ajusted by relative consumer prices, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting major trade partner economies, adjusted by relative consumer prices, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Year-over-year (YOY) percent change (advanced economies only)
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting advanced economies, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted by relative unit labor costs, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change (advanced economies only)
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting advanced economies, adjusted by relative unit labor costs, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted by relative unit labor costs, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change (advanced economies only)
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting advanced economies, adjusted by relative unit labor costs, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted by relative unit labor costs, percent change (advanced economies only)
str:Code.com:Description: Weighted index reflecting advanced economies trade partners only, adjusted by relative unit labor costs, percent change

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted by imports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: This is used to analyze the change in import values over a specific period, where the average import value is calculated by weighting different import categories based on their relative importance. This gives more weight to the changes in import categories that are more significant in the country's overall import structure.

str:Code.com:Name: Weighted by exports, period average
str:Code.com:Description: This metric analyzes the change in export values over a specific period. The average export value is calculated by weighting different export categories based on their relative importance. This weighting gives more influence to changes in the more significant export categories within the country's overall export structure.

str:Code.com:Name: Per capita, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change between the end-of-period value per capita for the current year and the end-of-period value per capita for the previous year.

str:Code.com:Name: In weeks of imports
str:Code.com:Description: It refers to a metric expressing a country's foreign exchange reserves (typically held by its central bank) relative to the estimated value of its imports. It indicates how many weeks of imports the country could afford if its reserves remained unchanged and its import levels were projected forward. This is a measure of a country's external liquidity and its ability to withstand shocks to its balance of payments.

str:Code.com:Name: 6-month rolling monthly squared change
str:Code.com:Description: Measures the volatility of a data series by calculating the squared difference between each month's value and the previous month's value, averaged over a rolling 6-month window. One unit is equivalent to one standard deviation of the standardized variable.
